AEM13920 Portal
Data Structures | Functions
HAL Driver API

Description

AEM13920's HAL Driver's API.


This document describes the AEM13920 HAL Driver's API. It provides information about all the functions and data structures that can be used to interface the AEM.

Please refer to the Getting Started page for further guidance on how to use this driver

Version
1.0.0
  • Minor bug fixes
1.0.1
  • Minor bug fixes
1.1.0 API Improvement
  • Precise in and out parameters in the API documentation Deprecation
  • Deprecate GetAPMSource and GetAPMBuck, replaced by GetAPMDataSRC and GetAPMDataBuck
1.1.1 Bug Fix
  • Remove useless condition

Data Structure Documentation

◆ AEM13920_Config

struct AEM13920_Config

AEM13920's configuration settings.

Data Fields
uint32_t src1ReguV SRC2 Regulation Voltage (mV)
Precondition
src1ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_CONST
Note
If the specified voltage is under 0.12V, the AEM will go to sleep mode.
If it is above 1.47V, it will be forced to 1.47V
uint32_t src2ReguV SRC2 Regulation Voltage (mV)
Precondition
src2ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_CONST
Note
If the specified voltage is under 0.12V, the AEM will go to sleep mode.
If it is above 1.47V, it will be forced to 1.47V
uint32_t dischargeThresh Discharge (Vovdis) threshold.

Minimum voltage accepted on the storage element before stopping to supply LOAD (mV)

Note
If the specified threshold is under 2.4V, it will be forced to 2.4V
If the specified threshold is above 3.581V, it will be forced to 3.581V
uint32_t chargeReadyThresh Charge ready (Vchrdy) threshold.

Minimum voltage accepted on the storage element before starting to supply LOAD in START STATE (mV)

Note
It the specified threshold is under 2.456V, it will be forced to 2.456V
If the specified threshold is above 3.637V, it will be forced to 3.637V
uint32_t overchargeThresh Overcharge (Vovch) threshold.

Maximum voltage accepted on the storage element before disabling its charging (mV)

Note
If the specified threshold is under 2.7V, it will be forced to 2.7V
If the specified threshold is above 4.594V, it will be forced to 4.594V
uint32_t Rdiv Impedance of the resistor Rdiv, that creates a resistive voltage divider together with the thermistor Rth (mOhms)
Note
This setting is only required when using the Temperature Monitoring feature.
uint32_t coldChThreshZ Impedance of the thermistor (Rth) at the 'cold' threshold for storage element charging (mOhms)
Note
This setting is only required when using the Temperature Monitoring feature.
uint32_t hotChThreshZ Impedance of the thermistor (Rth) at the 'hot' threshold for storage element charging (mOhms)
Note
This setting is only required when using the Temperature Monitoring feature.
uint32_t coldDisThreshZ Impedance of the thermistor (Rth) at the 'cold' threshold for storage element discharging (mOhms)
Note
This setting is only required when using the Temperature Monitoring feature.
uint32_t hotDisThreshZ Impedance of the thermistor (Rth) at the 'hot' threshold for storage element discharging (mOhms)
Note
This setting is only required when using the Temperature Monitoring feature.
AEM13920_SRCREGU_MODE src1ReguMode SRC1 Regulation mode.
AEM13920_MPPT_RATIO src1MpptRatio SRC1 MPP tracking ratio (Vmpp/Voc)
Precondition
src1ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_MPPT_DURATION src1MpptDuration SRC1 MPP tracking duraction.
Precondition
src1ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_MPPT_PERIOD src1MpptPeriod SRC1 MPP tracking period.
Precondition
src1ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_SRCREGU_MODE src2ReguMode SRC2 Regulation mode.
AEM13920_MPPT_RATIO src2MpptRatio SRC2 MPP tracking ratio (Vmpp/Voc)
Precondition
src2ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_MPPT_DURATION src2MpptDuration SRC2 MPP tracking duraction.
Precondition
src2ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_MPPT_PERIOD src2MpptPeriod SRC2 MPP tracking period.
Precondition
src2ReguMode set to AEM13920_SRCREGU_MPPT
AEM13920_TMULT boost1TimingMult Timing multiplier for source 1's boost.
Note
This setting has no effect if source 1's boost is disabled
AEM13920_TMULT boost2TimingMult Timing multiplier for source 2's boost.
Note
This setting has no effect if source 2's boost is disabled
AEM13920_VLOAD buckVLoad Buck converter output regulation voltage.
AEM13920_TMULT buckTimingMult Timing multiplier for the buck converter.
AEM13920_SLEEP_THRESHOLD src1SleepThresh SRC1 sleep threshold.
AEM13920_SLEEP_THRESHOLD src2SleepThresh SRC1 sleep threshold.
AEM13920_APM_MODE apmMode Average Power Monitoring operation mode.
Note
This setting is only required when using the Average Power Monitoring feature.
AEM13920_APM_WINDOW apmWindow Computation window for the Average Power Monitoring.
Note
This setting is only required when using the Average Power Monitoring feature.
AEM13920_IRQEN irq IRQs configuration.
bool enableBoost1 Enable/Disable the boost converter 1.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableHPBoost1 Enable/Disable the automatic high power mode for the boost converter 1.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableBoost2 Enable/Disable the boost converter 2.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableHPBoost2 Enable/Disable the automatic high power mode for the boost converter 2.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableAPMSRC1 Enable/Disable the Average Power Monitoring for SRC1.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableAPMSRC2 Enable/Disable the Average Power Monitoring for SRC2.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableAPMBuck Enable/Disable the Average Power Monitoring for the Buck.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

bool enableTempMonitoring Enable/Disable the ambient Temperature Monitoring.

Set to true to enable, to false to disable

uint16_t _reserved reserved

Function Documentation

◆ AEM13920_Initialize()

int32_t AEM13920_Initialize ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg)

Initialize the communication interface.

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
The AEM is out of its reset sequence (see the datasheet, 8.1.2)
Postcondition
The communication interface is initialized, and the driver's functions can be used

◆ AEM13920_Deinitialize()

int32_t AEM13920_Deinitialize ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg)

Deinitialize the driver.

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
Postcondition
Any resources allocated to the communication interface are released. Any call to the driver's functions will fail until the AEM13920_Initialize() function is called

◆ AEM13920_GetChipVersion()

int32_t AEM13920_GetChipVersion ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
uint8_t *  version 
)

Get the chip version.

This function reads the VERSION register of the AEM, and sets version accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[out]versionChip version
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
version is not NULL
Postcondition
version is set with the chip version

◆ AEM13920_GetConfigurationSource()

int32_t AEM13920_GetConfigurationSource ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
uint8_t *  source 
)

Get the active configuration source.

This function reads the UPDATE field of the CTRL register of the AEM, and sets source accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[out]sourceSource of configuration
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
source is not NULL
Postcondition
source is set with the reference of the current configuration source. Takes its value from AEM13920_CFGSRC

◆ AEM13920_GetStatus()

int32_t AEM13920_GetStatus ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
AEM13920_Status *  status 
)

Get the AEM's status.

This function reads the STATUS register of the AEM, and sets status accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[out]statusAEM's status
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
status is not NULL
Postcondition
status is set with the AEM's status

◆ AEM13920_GetSynchronizationStatus()

int32_t AEM13920_GetSynchronizationStatus ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
bool *  sync 
)

Get the synchronization busy flag.

This function reads the SYNCBUSY field of the CTRL register of the AEM, and sets sync accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[out]syncSynchronization flag
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
sync is not NULL
Postcondition
sync is set to true if the synchronization of the I2C registers and the system registers is ongoing, to false otherwise
Note
Use this function after calls to the AEM13920_LoadConfiguration() or AEM13920_Configure() functions to ensure the synchronization is complete before any attempt to read the configuration

◆ AEM13920_GetIRQFlags()

int32_t AEM13920_GetIRQFlags ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
AEM13920_IRQFLG *  flags 
)

Get the AEM's interrupt flags.

This function reads the IRQFLG register of the AEM, and sets flags accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[out]flagsInterrupt flags
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
flags is not NULL
Postcondition
flags is set with the IRQ flags of the AEM

◆ AEM13920_GetAPMSource()

int32_t AEM13920_GetAPMSource ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
AEM13920_Source  src,
uint32_t *  apm,
AEM13920_LDCDC  Ldcdc 
)

Get the APM data for the selected source.

Deprecated:
Use AEM13920_GetAPMDataSRC() instead

This function reads the APM0SRCx, APM1SRCx and APM2SRCx registers, and sets apm accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[in]srcSelected source
[out]apmAPM data
[in]LdcdcValue of the DCDC converter inductor
(ignored in Pulse Counter Mode)
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
In Power Meter mode, Ldcdc must be set with the value of the DCDC converter inductor (see AEM13920_LDCDC)
src is a valid source
apm is not NULL
Postcondition
In Power Meter mode, apm is set with the energy value Eapm, in nano-Joules
In Pulse Counter mode, apm is set with the number of pulses

◆ AEM13920_GetAPMDataSRC()

int32_t AEM13920_GetAPMDataSRC ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
AEM13920_Source  src,
uint32_t *  data,
uint32_t *  offset 
)

Get the APM data for the selected source.

This function reads the APM0SRCx, APM1SRCx and APM2SRCx registers and sets data and offset accordingly

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[in]srcSelected source
[out]dataAPM data
[out]offsetOffset
Returns
int32_t AEM00900_STATUS_ERR_CODE
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
src is a valid source
data is not NULL
offset is not NULL
Postcondition
In Pulse Counter mode, data is set with the number of pulses, and offset is not used (set to 0).
In Power Metor mode, data is set with the data, and offset is set with the offset to be applied to it. To complete the conversion into nano-Joules, refer to the formula given into the product's datasheet.

◆ AEM13920_GetAPMBuck()

int32_t AEM13920_GetAPMBuck ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
uint32_t *  apm,
AEM13920_LDCDC  Ldcdc

Get the APM data for the buck converter.

Parameters

[out]apmAPM data

(ignored in Pulse Counter Mode)
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
In Power Meter mode, Ldcdc must be set with the value of the DCDC converter inductor (see AEM13920_LDCDC)
apm is not NULL
Postcondition
In Power Meter mode, apm is set with the energy value Eapm, in nano-Joules
In Pulse Counter mode, apm is set with the number of pulses

◆ AEM13920_GetAPMDataBuck()

uint32_t *  data,
uint32_t *  offset 
)

Returns

offset is not NULL
Postcondition

In Power Metor mode, data is set with the data, and offset is set with the offset to be applied to it. To complete the conversion into nano-Joules, refer to the formula given into the product's datasheet.

◆ AEM13920_GetThermistorZ()

int32_t AEM13920_GetThermistorZ ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg,
uint32_t *  Rth,
uint32_t  Rdiv 
)

Get the thermistor's impedance.

This function reads the TEMP register of the AEM, and sets Rth accordingly.

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
[in]RdivImpedance of the resistor that creates a resistive voltage divider with Rth (mOhms)
[out]RthImpedance of the thermistor used for the thermal monitoring feature (mOhms)
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
Rdiv holds the impedance of the resistor Rdiv (mOhms)
Rth is not NULL
Postcondition
Rth is set with the thermistor's impedance (mOhms)
Note
Rth can be converted to Celsius degrees either by refering to the correspondance table that should be supplied by the thermistor's manufacturer, or by implementing the Steinhart-Hart equation.
The user willing to work with the Steinhart-Hart equation could proceed as follows. This is an implementation of the simplified SteinhartHart equation, aka 'beta parameter equation', which returns the temperature in Celsius degrees from Rth the thermistor's impedance, T0 the thermistor's nominal temperature in Celsius degrees (usually 25C), R0 the thermistor's nominal impedance and beta the thermistor's beta constant (kelvins):
#include <stdint.h>
#include <math.h>
#define __KELVIN_CONV (273.15f)
int32_t ConvertThermistorZ(uint32_t Rth, uint32_t T0, uint32_t R0, uint32_t beta)
{
float T0k = T0 + __KELVIN_CONV; // Convert T0 to Kelvins
float dividend = ((float) beta * T0k);
float divisor = ((float) beta + (T0k * logf((float) Rth / R0)));
float temp = dividend / divisor;
return roundf(temp - __KELVIN_CONV); // Convert to Celsius and round
}

This function sets the BUCKEN field of the APM register

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information

◆ AEM13920_LoadConfiguration()

int32_t AEM13920_LoadConfiguration ( const AEM_i2c_cfg *  i2cCfg)

Update the AEM's behavior according to the configuration set into the I2C registers.

This function sets the UPDATE field of the CTRL register and blocks until the synchronisation is done

Parameters
[in]i2cCfgCommunication interface's required information
Returns
int32_t Status/Error code
Precondition
i2cCfg is not NULL
i2cCfg has been correctly initialized, as described in the I2C Communication interface API
Postcondition
The AEM configuration has been updated
